titleStmt.title: A question answered: how laws are to be understood, and obedience yeelded? Necessary for the present state of things, touching the militia.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for the good of the Commonweale,

notesStmt.note: The King claims the disposing of the militia by law: the Parliament says the ordering of it is in them, in the presence of foreign invasion and Popish party at home. The Answer distinguishes between the equitable and literal sense of law. -- Steele.
Date and place of publication from Wing.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library (Early Eanglish books, 1641-1700, reel 1978) and the Henry E. Huntington and Art Gallery (Thomason Tracts, reel 245).
